metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12396 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability where a WebExtension can run content scripts in disallowed contexts following navigation or other events. This allows for potential privilege escalation by the WebExtension on sites where content scripts should not be run. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.3 and Firefox < 63.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12396` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 63.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 63.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 63.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
